C=E9dric,
 
Filtering was the point of the example, but Request is quite ge=
neral. There
are static methods for creating a Request for a single class, =
a single
method of a single class, or a list of classes. The example could =
have been
changed to:
    Request request=3D Request.classes(Example1.class=
, Example2.class);
 
More advanced users can implement their own Requests. =
Most test writers
won't see any of this plumbing, but it's nice to have the=
 flexibility when
you need it.
 
Sincerely yours,
 
Kent Beck
Three Rivers =
Institute


  _____

wrote:

> I don't understand your message.=
 Subclasses of Filter can be defined

Right, but one Filter cla=
ss can only filter one Test class since it's tied
to a Request class:

Requ=
est request=3D Request.aClass(Example.class);

I was just pointing out that=
 in my experience, filters that apply to the
entire test suite are more fle=
xible and usually more useful than filters
that apply to one test class onl=
y.
